Interviewer:
Do you have any special memories of your childhood?  Is there anything that happened that you particularly remember?

I fell down the stairs once when I was very small.  I didn't hurt myself badly, but I'll never forget it.

column3: She remembers {{c1::moving house}} when she was five.
column5: We moved house when I was five, and I remember it very well.  It was exciting.

column5: I was four and I went fishing with my granddad. I fell into the river.  Fortunately, it wasn't deep and my granddad pulled me out.  I was OK, but I'll always remember it.

column5: I don't know how old I was, maybe three. I was on a train with my mother and some other people – I don't know who they were. I was asleep, and I woke up suddenly. And everyone started laughing. I don't know why I remember that.

column5: My parents took me to Canada when I was very young.  We were visiting relatives.  It was Christmas and I couldn’t believe the amount of snow.  I thought it was wonderful.

column5: My earliest memory is from when I was about 18 months old when I was starting to walk.  We had a garden and I walked all the way to the end of it, which must have been about eight metres, but I couldn’t walk back and I cried.
